fields.description:
On JAC there has been cases where some requests that perform JQL queries (e.g. https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=) take a long time (30+ seconds).

This seems to be due to UserSearcherHelperImpl.getSuggestedUsers() performing a count of billable users unnecessarily.  It should be possible to replace this billable users count code with a limited UserSearchService query which would make it more efficient.

-----

From the comment of the HOT ticket:

It seems for some users the number of billable users is being retrieved which is expensive.  The stack dump shows this call running:

{noformat}
        ...
        at com.atlassian.jira.application.DefaultApplicationRoleManager.totalBillableUsers(DefaultApplicationRoleManager.java:554)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.util.UserSearcherHelperImpl.getSuggestedUsers(UserSearcherHelperImpl.java:134)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.util.UserSearcherHelperImpl.addUserGroupSuggestionParams(UserSearcherHelperImpl.java:77)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.util.UserSearcherHelperImpl.addUserGroupSuggestionParams(UserSearcherHelperImpl.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.renderer.AbstractUserSearchRenderer.addUserGroupSuggestionParams(AbstractUserSearchRenderer.java:225)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.renderer.AbstractUserSearchRenderer.getKickassVelocityParams(AbstractUserSearchRenderer.java:190)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.renderer.AbstractUserSearchRenderer.getVelocityParams(AbstractUserSearchRenderer.java:169)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.renderer.AbstractUserSearchRenderer.getEditHtml(AbstractUserSearchRenderer.java:88)
	at com.atlassian.jira.components.query.DefaultSearcherService.getEditHtml(DefaultSearcherService.java:412)
	at com.atlassian.jira.components.query.DefaultSearcherService.getValueResults(DefaultSearcherService.java:230)
	at com.atlassian.jira.components.query.DefaultSearcherService.getSearchResults(DefaultSearcherService.java:165)
	at com.atlassian.jira.components.query.DefaultSearcherService.searchWithJql(DefaultSearcherService.java:160)
        ...
{noformat}

Normally the total billable users value is cached, but on JAC there seems to be a high turnaround of users - whenever a user is added or removed this cached count is blown away and the next request has to refresh the count.  This count probably would take 20-30 seconds on a reasonably loaded system like JAC with 400k+ users.

The code that calls it is from UserSearcherHelperImpl.getSuggestedUsers():

{code}
...
            // JRADEV-15375 With a significant number of users in the system, a full sort is very slow and pointless to
            // suggest random users anyway. On the other hand, we do like putting_something_in here for evaluators...
            if (suggestedUsers.size() < limit && licenseCountService.totalBillableUsers() <= 10) {
                // Suggest the first 'limit' users in the system (if they don't already appear).
                List<ApplicationUser> allUsers = userSearchService.findUsers("", searchParams);
...
{code}

Really this code only needs to know if there is more than 10 users in the system or not, there are less expensive ways to work this out - using UserSearchService.findUsers() with a limit of 10 (UserSearchParams.maxResults) would be much more efficient as the limit is passed through to the database and can be performed nearly instantly.

Something [similar to this fix in project templates plugin|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRA/repos/jira-project-templates-plugin/browse/project-templates-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/jira/projecttemplates/rest/ProjectTemplatesResource.java?at=ddaacde096eaa7371568f906e7b48842d390ac09#82] but with a [limit|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/JIRA/repos/jira-project-templates-plugin/browse/project-templates-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/jira/projecttemplates/rest/ProjectTemplatesResource.java?at=ddaacde096eaa7371568f906e7b48842d390ac09#76] of 10 instead of 2.
fields.summary: Inefficient user count in UserSearcherHelperImpl.getSuggestedUsers()

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There are several places where autocompletion is not as smart as it should be:
- When typing an @-mention to reference a person in an issue, autocomplete should prioritize people who are already watching/associated with the issue. For example, if I type "@john", I shouldn't have to search through all the Johns in Yahoo if I intend to reply to one who already commented on the same issue.
- When typing an epic name (e.g. when adding an epic to an issue), autocomplete should prioritize epics associated with the board I'm using. It's confusing to start typing an epic name and be presented with all the epics in the entire Jira system.



h3. Suggested Solution
 Nothing at the moment
fields.summary: Autocomplete suggestions
Pasting data that can be interpreted as text or image data prefers screenshot attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59689].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Before the release of JIRA 7, users without the JIRA *Users Global Permission* were not able to log in to JIRA, but if they belonged to a group that had Create Issue permission for a project, they could create issues via email if a JIRA email handler was set up, as documented here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email

In JIRA 7, a user must have access to at least one JIRA application (JIRA Software, JIRA Service Desk, or JIRA Core) in order to create issues, regardless of how the issue is created. This means that any user that is not able to log in to JIRA and create an issue via the Create Issue dialog will not be able to create issues via a JIRA email handler. This changes caused the existing JIRA Mail Handlers to throw messages when performing a test run.

!Selection_076.png|thumbnail!


h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the users without application access to create issue via email if they belong to a group that has permission to create issue in JIRA.


h3. Workaround 
Set up anonymous issue creation as [documented here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Allowing+anonymous+access+to+your+project] and change the email addresses of users being deleted or disabled so they are not matched by the mail handler: [JRA-33116|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-33116]

Another workaround would be to have a "Forward Email" address in the mail handler so you are notified on failing emails and users can be manually enabled or created.
fields.summary: JIRA users need application access to create issue via email

Hi 

Need quick help in fixing this issue as this is a critical production related concern. 
We face an Error in Deleting an Issue & Uploading an Attachment 

The Error Log is below : 

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: io/atlassian/blobstore/plugin/analytics/Event$Type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59683].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Permission schemes that have non-existent users explicitly added to a permission type cannot be edited (the header and sidebar load, but where the permissions should be listed is blank).

There's two situations where this can occur:

1) A user exists in a user directory, is granted explicit permission in a permission scheme, and the user directory that the user is in is subsequently disabled.

2) Back in the days of JIRA Studio and Enterprise Hosted instances, there were two special users with the usernames "enterprise-hosted-support" or "contegix" (or both) that were the equivalent of the current "sysadmin" user. There's several places in JIRA's codebase that check for this username and exclude it from various operations.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Start a local JIRA, connect it to an external user directory of some sort.
# Add a user that exists only in that directory (and not the internal JIRA directory) to a permission scheme.
# Import that JIRA data into a Cloud instance.
# Try to edit the permission scheme.

h3. Expected results
The permission scheme page loads.

h3. Actual results
Where the permissions _should_ be is blank, and this stack trace is thrown in the logs:

{code:none}
2016-02-03 14:23:31,764 http-nio-2990-exec-53 ERROR sysadmin 863x4563x1 15k3ark 103.233.242.8,104.192.140.242,127.0.0.1 /rest/internal/2/managedpermissionscheme/0 [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.updateSchemeToReturnUsername(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:436)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.access$2200(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService$13.apply(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:331)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService$13.apply(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:327)
	at com.atlassian.fugue.Option$Some.fold(Option.java:421)
	at com.atlassian.fugue.Option.flatMap(Option.java:287)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.getScheme(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:327)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.DefaultPermissionSchemeService.getPermissionScheme(DefaultPermissionSchemeService.java:105)
	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.management.ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.getManagedPermissionScheme(ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.java:92)
	... 3 filtered
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.util.ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.java:26)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy131.getManagedPermissionScheme(Unknown Source)
	... 3 filtered
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
[...]
{code}

h3. Workarounds
h4. Workaround 1
For Cloud specifically, the following SQL will find the individual user and which permission scheme they're part of:

{code:sql}
SELECT  distinct(p.name),
        s.perm_type,
        s.perm_parameter
FROM    permissionscheme p,
        schemepermissions s
WHERE   p.id = s.scheme AND
        s.perm_parameter NOT IN (
            SELECT  user_name
            FROM    cwd_user
            WHERE   directory_id = (
                SELECT  id
                FROM    cwd_directory
                WHERE   directory_name = 'Remote Crowd Directory'
            )
        ) AND
        s.perm_type = 'user'
ORDER BY p.name asc;
{code}

To remove all of the missing users from the permission schemes:

{code:sql}
DELETE FROM schemepermissions
WHERE perm_type = 'user' AND
perm_parameter NOT IN (
    SELECT  user_name
    FROM    cwd_user
    WHERE   directory_id = (
        SELECT  id
        FROM    cwd_directory
        WHERE   directory_name = 'Remote Crowd Directory'
    )
);
{code}

h4. Workaround 2
# Create a user with the same username for any broken reference
# Change the Permission Scheme to remove the reference
# Remove the users
fields.summary: Permission schemes with non-existent users that have been explicitly granted a permission cannot be edited

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Version Picker (multiple versions) custom field incorrectly persists data in the change history table when making changes to issues. This can cause project imports to subsequently fail as the data's not in an expected state.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Version Picker (multiple versions).
 # Create an issue in a project that has versions.
 # Edit the issue to have a version in that field.

h3. Expected Results

The data is persisted normally.
h3. Actual Results

The data is persisted inside square brackets, such as {{[123456]}}, instead of {{123456}}.

This can also lead to project imports failing with the below exception:
{noformat}
2016-01-22 16:20:57,097 JiraTaskExectionThread-10 ERROR sysadmin 978x3742x1 z25doj 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/ProjectImportSummary.jspa [c.a.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl] Task 'Importing project 'Central Services'.' failed.
java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "[10150]"
	at sun.misc.FloatingDecimal.readJavaFormatString(FloatingDecimal.java:2043)
	at sun.misc.FloatingDecimal.parseDouble(FloatingDecimal.java:110)
	at java.lang.Double.parseDouble(Double.java:538)
	at java.lang.Double.<init>(Double.java:608)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.customfield.VersionCustomFieldImporter.getNonDecimalValue(VersionCustomFieldImporter.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.customfield.VersionCustomFieldImporter.getMappedImportValue(VersionCustomFieldImporter.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.transformer.ChangeItemTransformerImpl.mapCustomFieldIdList(ChangeItemTransformerImpl.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.transformer.ChangeItemTransformerImpl.transform(ChangeItemTransformerImpl.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.handler.ChangeItemPersisterHandler.handleEntity(ChangeItemPersisterHandler.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.handler.ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.endTopLevelElement(ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.java:219)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.handler.ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.endElement(ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.java:167)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.handler.ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.endElement(ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.java:134)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.endElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractXMLDocumentParser.emptyElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanStartElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl$FragmentContentDispatcher.dispatch(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanDocument(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XMLParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserImpl$JAXPSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.security.xml.RestrictedXMLReader.parse(RestrictedXMLReader.java:103)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.xml.DefaultBackupXmlParser$XmlParser.parseXml(DefaultBackupXmlParser.java:115)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.xml.DefaultBackupXmlParser.parse(DefaultBackupXmlParser.java:64)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.xml.DefaultBackupXmlParser.parseXml(DefaultBackupXmlParser.java:52)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.xml.DefaultBackupXmlParser.parseOfBizBackupXml(DefaultBackupXmlParser.java:41)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.DefaultProjectImportManager.importChangeItemEntities(DefaultProjectImportManager.java:1113)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.DefaultProjectImportManager.doImport(DefaultProjectImportManager.java:659)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.imports.project.DefaultProjectImportService.doImport(DefaultProjectImportService.java:416)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.importer.project.ProjectImportSummary$ProjectImportCallable.call(ProjectImportSummary.java:285)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.importer.project.ProjectImportSummary$ProjectImportCallable.call(ProjectImportSummary.java:236)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:458)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:426)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ForkedThreadExecutor$ForkedRunnableDecorator.run(ForkedThreadExecutor.java:216)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}
Also if the workaround is applied without removing empty values it can result in the following:
{noformat}
2016-10-13 12:09:30,335 JiraTaskExectionThread-9 ERROR jira_user 728x1290x1 1osbo1w 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/ProjectImportSummary.jspa [c.a.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl] Task 'Importing project 'JEM 2.0'.' failed.
java.lang.NumberFormatException: empty String
	at sun.misc.FloatingDecimal.readJavaFormatString(FloatingDecimal.java:1842)
	at sun.misc.FloatingDecimal.parseDouble(FloatingDecimal.java:110)
	at java.lang.Double.parseDouble(Double.java:538)
	at java.lang.Double.<init>(Double.java:608)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.customfield.VersionCustomFieldImporter.getNonDecimalValue(VersionCustomFieldImporter.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.customfield.VersionCustomFieldImporter.getMappedImportValue(VersionCustomFieldImporter.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.transformer.ChangeItemTransformerImpl.mapCustomFieldIdList(ChangeItemTransformerImpl.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.transformer.ChangeItemTransformerImpl.transform(ChangeItemTransformerImpl.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.handler.ChangeItemPersisterHandler.handleEntity(ChangeItemPersisterHandler.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.handler.ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.endTopLevelElement(ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.java:219)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.handler.ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.endElement(ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.java:167)
	at com.atlassian.jira.imports.project.handler.ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.endElement(ChainedOfBizSaxHandler.java:134)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.endElement(Unknown Source)
{noformat}
h3. Notes

The XML backup and restore functionality will still continue to work.
h3. Workaround

If needing to project import, the database can be edited with the below steps. These were verified on PostgreSQL and the syntax may vary for different DBMS.

 1. Backup JIRA.
 2. Stop JIRA.
 3. Run these queries to identify the rows you need to update:
{code:sql}
SELECT * FROM changeitem WHERE oldvalue LIKE '[%]' OR newvalue LIKE '[%]';{code}
4. Execute the below SQL to remove the brackets:
{code:sql}
UPDATE changeitem SET oldvalue = TRIM(BOTH '[]' FROM oldvalue), newvalue = TRIM(BOTH '[]' FROM newvalue) WHERE field = '<affected field name>';{code}
5. In some cases, this may cause empty values to be present. We can identify these cases with the following query:
{code:sql}
SELECT * FROM changeitem WHERE oldvalue = '' OR newvalue = '';{code}
6. We can fix these with the below (run the first query if {{oldvalue}} is the field that's blank, and the second query if it's {{newvalue}} that's blank):
{code:sql}
UPDATE changeitem SET oldvalue = NULL WHERE oldvalue = '' AND field = <affected field name>;
UPDATE changeitem SET newvalue = NULL WHERE newvalue = '' AND field = <affected field name>;{code}
7. Start JIRA.
 8. Generate an XML backup and use that for importing into the target instance.

KB article related to this: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/version-picker-multiple-versions-incorrectly-persists-data-in-jira-change-history-875322422.html
fields.summary: Version Picker (multiple versions) incorrectly persists data in JIRA change history

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59679].
  {panel}

JIRA needs public rest API's that can answer the following questions:

* Is this user a member of this project role?
* Does this user have this permission? (Potentially covered by [this|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/user-findUsersWithAllPermissions])
* In what projects does is the user a member of the given project role?

In general, for Atlassian Connect add-ons, you need to be able to tell what permissions you have to various projects.

See: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/35764459/working-with-project-roles-effectively for an example of some of the uses cases required.
fields.summary: Make public rest API's to ask permission questions of JIRA
Command + Return should submit the current form

h3. Problem Definition

fields.description:
h3. Summary
New user Directories do not contain existing nested group relations. Users within the new directory can be added to groups, but won't obtain the parent group membership. It is also not possible to modify the nested group to group memberships to get this updated.

h3. Environment
JIRA using multiple User Directories and having a new one added.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA instance with two directories:
** JIRA Internal and JIRA Delegated directory
# Enable Nested local groups for all directories
# Create group: {{Parent}} and {{Child}}
# Create relationship (nested) between these groups
# Add a user to the Child group
** Note that on the User page, it shows the user will be part of both Parent and Child groups
# Add a new JIRA Delegated directory
# Create a new user in this new directory
# Add the new user to the Child group
** Notice that this new user is only part of the Child group and not the Parent

h3. Expected Results
Users in the new directory are added to the Child group and also gain membership to the Parent group

h3. Actual Results
Users in the new directory are added to the Child group and do not show membership to Parent

h3. Cause
{code}
select id, directory_name from cwd_directory;

  id  |     directory_name
----+-----------------------------
    1 | JIRA Internal Directory
10000 | JIRA Delegated LDAP
10100 | JIRA Delegated LDAP - New
{code}  

{code}
select id, membership_type, parent_name, child_name, directory_id from cwd_membership where parent_name = 'Parent Group';

  id   | membership_type | parent_name  | child_name  | directory_id
-------+-----------------+--------------+-------------+--------------
 10100 | GROUP_GROUP     | Parent Group | Child Group |            1
 10200 | GROUP_GROUP     | Parent Group | Child Group |        10000
{code}
* This shows the Parent to Child memberships only for the original directories. A new GROUP_GROUP entry was not added for the new directory

h3. Workaround
* Manually add the GROUP_GROUP relation to the {{cwd_membership}} table for the newly created directory.
* Restart JIRA
fields.summary: Nested Group Relations are not Recognized for New Directories

fields.description:
The message "Some issue types are unavailable due to incompatible field configuration and/or workflow associations." is useful on the edit screen to inform users that they may not be able to simply change issue types by editing the Issue Type field.  However, there doesn't seem to be a good reason why this message would be displayed on the create screen.

Fresh JIRA instances do not seem to suffer from this problem, but many of my established JIRA instances display this message on every create screen for every issue type in every project.  JAC in fact seems to display this same behavior.

I have tried troubleshooting this phenomenon by playing around with field contexts, field configurations, screens, workflows, and add-ons, but alas have no insight to offer as to what causes this message to appear on the create screen in some JIRA instances and not others.
fields.summary: On the create screen the message "Some issue types are unavailable due to incompatible field configuration and/or workflow associations." appears beneath Issue Type

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In windows running the config.bat presents an error of:
{code}
Wrong JVM version!  JIRA requires at least 1.8 to run.
{code}

This error is presented even though JAVA_HOME is correctly set and can be verified by typing in java -version at a command prompt.  Doing so returns :  Java Version "1.8.0_060"

JAVA_HOME is set as : c:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_60
results of 'set JAVA_Home' command:  c:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.8.0_60

h3. Environment
Windows

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Run config.bat from command line in windows
Note previously mentioned error, config tool does not run

h3. Expected Results
Correct installed java version is detected an config tool runs.

h3. Actual Results
The below error is shown in command prompt window
{noformat}
Wrong JVM version!  JIRA requires at least 1.8 to run.
...
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
The config.bat file references the check-java.bat file which by default is:

{code} 
 
@ECHO OFF

setlocal

rem
rem check for correct java version by parsing out put of java -version
rem we expect first line to be in format "java version 1.8.0" and assert that minor version number will be 8 or higher
rem

set EXPECTED_JAVA_VERSION=8

for /f "tokens=2 delims=." %%a in ('%_EXECJAVA% -version 2^>^&1') do (
   set VERSION=%%a
   goto loaded_version
)
goto wrong_version

:loaded_version
IF %VERSION% LSS %EXPECTED_JAVA_VERSION% goto wrong_version

goto:eof

:wrong_version
echo %%a
echo *******************************************************************************
echo *******      Wrong JVM version! JIRA requires at least 1.8 to run.      *******
echo *******************************************************************************
exit /b 1
{code}

This does not produce a valid return even though the correct java version is installed.

h3.Workaround
I was able to workaround the issue by modifying the check-java.bat file to the following:

{code}
@ECHO OFF

setlocal

rem
rem check for correct java version by parsing out put of java -version
rem we expect first line to be in format "java version 1.8.0" and assert that minor version number will be 8 or higher
rem

set EXPECTED_JAVA_VERSION=8

for /f "tokens=3" %%g in ('java -version 2^>^&1 ^| findstr /i "version"') do (
    set JAVAVER=%%g
)
set JAVAVER=%JAVAVER:"=%


for /f "delims=. tokens=2" %%v in ("%JAVAVER%") do (
   
   set JAVA=%%v
   goto loaded_version
)

:loaded_version
IF %JAVA% LSS %EXPECTED_JAVA_VERSION% goto wrong_version


goto:eof

:wrong_version
echo *******************************************************************************
echo *******      Wrong JVM version! JIRA requires at least 1.8 to run.      *******
echo *******************************************************************************
exit /b 1
{code}
fields.summary: config.bat script does not correctly detect Java version on Windows

  {panel}

We need the ability to log work on closed issues without allowing any other updates to the issue.   Today with the  _jira.issue.editable = false_ we can log comments but we can't add work logs. 

Since this behaviour might not be desirable by everyone I suggest a new Workflow Step Property like  

_jira.issue.logwork = true/false_

and thus people desiring this functionality could set up their Closed status as

_jira.issue.editable false_
_jira.issue.logwork true_

in the past there have been cumbersome workarounds with hidden workflow steps but the "hide transition" now hides it from everything but workflow triggers.  A solution like this would benefit everyone who needs to log time on a closed issue without actually re-opening it.
fields.summary: ability to log work on Closed issues when jira.issue.editable = false

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59641].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

The "Description" for a custom field is not displayed on the View Issue screen. It is only displayed on the Edit and Create issue screens. 
h3. Why this is important

When we do create new custom fields we try to give them generic names which are not project specific and can be ‘re-used’ by other projects. A custom description is then used at a project level to make the field more meaningful on the screen. However there is a limit as to how generic a field name can be before it becomes meaningless. In the situation we currently have we need 4 fields each of which can have a yes / no response. The information being captured for this project is specific to one project only so if the ‘full’ field name is used it is unlikely it will ever be re-used by a subsequent project. However if we just called the new fields very generic names (eg ‘Check Box 1’) and had a custom context field description the field could be re-used. The problem comes when the issue is ‘viewed’ rather than created / edited. In create or edit the field descriptions are displayed but in ‘view’ just the field name is shown. This means that if we had 4 new ‘check box’ fields it would not be clear to someone when ‘viewing’ the issue as to which field was which and what it related to.
h3. Suggested Solution

It should show custom field description when 'viewing' the issue.
h3. Workaround
 * Click Create/Edit issue to see the field description
fields.summary: Show custom field description on the issue view screen

h3. Summary
Currently when user tries to do Project Import from JIRA Cloud to latest version of JIRA Server, they will be prompted with the error message:
(x) *This data appears to be from an older version of JIRA. Please upgrade the data and try again. The current version of JIRA is at build number '70119', but the supplied backup file was for build number '71001'.*

fields.description:
After creating a plugin and attempting to run it, the license supplied by the Atlassian SDK for JIRA is a commercial license. When you attempt to switch this to a developer license provided from my.atlassian.com, the change fails with the following message:

{quote}The license could not be installed.

This license does not match the type of JIRA currently licensed. This is a license for DEVELOPER JIRA, which does not match your existing license for COMMERCIAL JIRA. Please remove all other licenses for COMMERCIAL JIRA if you'd like to change the type of your JIRA instance. For more information please see License compatibility.
{quote}

Steps to reproduce:
* Install the current version of the Atlassian Plugin SDK
* Create a new JIRA plugin with atlas-plugin-create
* Run the plugin with atlas-run
* Attempt to update the JIRA Core license to a developer license.


Related workaround from Atlassian Answers:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/33141167/sdk-developers-licence-jira-software-
fields.summary: Attempting to use a Developer License in a copy of JIRA created using the Atlassian SDK Fails

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, JIRA counts all users to the license count. However, Admins may have non-human users that are only for technical purposes, like synchronizing JIRA, after logging into JIRA, with an external system. This could be a huge factor in Service Desk, where the lowest license tier has 3 agents and therefore the admin might not have the luxury to have a non-human task like synchronization get counted as a single user. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a way to handle non-human users, so that they do not get counted towards the license.

This is a feature request (though probably in the wrong spot). 

One of our users is having her name autocompleted in Safari. This can be disabled on a per-user level but not (easily) for every user in the site. 

This feature I believe would be useful in the system settings. 

This is the guide to set this flag per user: https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf54/confluence-user-s-guide/creating-content/using-the-editor/using-autocomplete#UsingAutocomplete-Enablinganddisablingautocomplete
fields.summary: Disable Autocomplete for Site

When you move around issues, it makes it possible to skip a key number *(PRJ-XXX)* where it shouldn't occur. This causes a skip in the autoincrementing nature of a project

What I did:
* I Imported a project via csv
* someone moved an issue from one project to the newly created project (new key was PRJ-255)
* I noticed that someone went wrong with the import and I need to do it again
* I moved the same bug* (PRJ-255)* back to the other project assigned a new key *(ABC-2465)*
* Deleted the imported project and reimported it
* Moved the issue* (ABC-2465) *to the correctly imported project and the key assigned was *(PRJ-256)*

I would have expected the key to be {color:red}* PRJ-256*{color} and now because of that, there is a missing key in my project

h3. Summary
When entering data into a comment (eg. into comment section), a user can accidentally click on a link in the page causing the browser to re-direct to the new page. Clicking the *Back* button of the browser will return the user to the original issue. However, the behaviour is inconsistent in regards to the already entered data
||Type of project||Chrome||Firefox||
||Normal Project|Clicking *Back* will reload all previously entered data|Clicking *Back* will load a new page. Any data entered previously will be lost|


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any Business project issue ticket , and create a comment .
# Before added the comment , go back at previous session or click at any link in the comment.
# Then , go back to the issue ticket screens.
# Check on the comment fields.

h3. Expected Results
* As a business/software project can retrieve the entered data for Chrome and Firefox

h3. Actual Results
* As a business/software project can retrieve the entered data for chrome , however its not working for *Firefox*

h3.Workaround
* No known workaround

h3. Suggestion
# Make Firefox (and all other supported browsers) behave the same and able to retrieve entered data; 
*OR*
# Have a pop up which warns users such that entered data will be lost

h3. Note
# The problem was fixed for JIRA Service Desk project , as stated in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-2301 . However , the problem still persist for non Service Desk project.
fields.summary: Save comment data when go back to the screen after go to other screen

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59604].
  {panel}

At the moment, a JIRA Cloud export is not directly imported in JIRA Cloud.
The following guide explains the process that an administrator has to go through to achieve the migration: [How to restore a JIRA Cloud application backup into another JIRA Cloud application|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+restore+a+JIRA+Cloud+application+backup+into+another+JIRA+Cloud+application]

The Migration is mostly used for [Changing the Cloud Instance URL Address or Migrating to a New Cloud Instance|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/Changing+the+Cloud+Instance+URL+Address+or+Migrating+to+a+New+Cloud+Instance] that also has a feature request for it: [CLOUD-7184|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CLOUD-7184]

The "JIRA Import" page describes:
{quote}
*Prerequisites*
# An export of your existing JIRA instance.
# Optionally, compressed copies of:
<JIRA_HOME>/data/attachments directory. The contents should either have the attachments directory as the top level directory, or the project keys within the attachments directory as the top level directories.
<JIRA_HOME>/data/avatars directory. The contents should have the avatars directory as the top level directory.
<JIRA_HOME>/logos directory. The contents should have the logos directory as the top level directory.
# Please note that your JIRA instance will not have any issues attachments, user avatars or project logos if they are not restored along with your exported JIRA data.
{quote}
It doesn't mention the additional steps to perform the import.

h3. Feature Request:
JIRA Cloud Imports from Cloud exports should work without manual data manipulation.

All the content is on the zip file and it is always in the same format.
This would avoid additional problems with compressing attachments in different types and confusion: [JRA-59603|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-59603]
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Cloud imports from Cloud exports without manual data manipulation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59576].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Relating to the Addition of the *Transition Issue Permission*:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-11564

Some Actions are dependent On Workflow transition Conditions rather than the action itself, and not reflected clearly in the documentation.  (Resolving and Closing an issue)

JIRA Server Documentation from Version {{6.3}} on and JIRA cloud Documentation Titled *Managing Project Permissions* needs to be updated to reflect this
Most recent versions:
- Cloud:
-- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracloud/managing-project-permissions-735941121.html
- Server:
-- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Project+Permissions
-- https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/managing-project-permissions-749382918.html

h3. Suggested Solution
Current Resolved Issue Permission:
||Resolve issues | Permission to resolve and reopen issues. This also includes the ability to set the 'Fix For version' field for issues. Also see the Close Issues permission.||

*Suggested UPDATE:*
||Resolve issues | Permission to resolve and reopen issues based on the workflow condition (Only users with Resolve Issues permission can execute this transition.) of a transition. This also includes the ability to set the 'Fix For version' field for issues. Also see the Close Issues permission. Also requires Transition Issue Permission||

Current Close issue Permission:
||Close Issue | Permission to close issues. (This permission is useful where, for example, developers resolve issues and testers close them). Also see the Resolve Issues permission.||

*Suggested UPDATE:*
||Close issues | Permission to close issues issues based on the workflow conditions (Only users with Resolve Issues permission can execute this transition. AND Only users with Close Issues permission can execute this transition.) for a workflow transition. (This permission is useful where, for example, developers resolve issues and testers close them). Also see the Resolve Issues permission. Also requires Transition Issue Permission||

Notation attempting to clarify this reads:
{quote}
Note that some permissions are dependent upon others to ensure that users can perform the actions needed. For example, in order for a user to be able to resolve an issue, that user must be granted both the Transition Issue permission and the Resolve Issue permission. 

The following table lists the different types of project permissions and the functions they secure. Note that project permissions can also be used in workflow conditions.
{quote}

Suggested update:
{quote}
Note that some permissions are dependent upon others to ensure that users can perform the actions needed. For example, in order for a user to be able to resolve an issue, that user must be granted both the Transition Issue permission and the Resolve Issue permission and the Transition Resolving the issue must have the necessary Condition (Only users with Resolve Issues permission can execute this transition.). 

The following table lists the different types of project permissions and the functions they secure. Note that project permissions can also be used in workflow conditions.  And Some are dependent on workflow Conditions.
{quote}
fields.summary: Certain Project Permissions are Based on Conditions Not action

fields.description:
We just found that there is a difference between timezone setting when setting up a Filter Subscription.

When using either of the first 3 options (Daily, Days/Week, Days/Month), it states and uses UTC. 

When setting up Advanced (which uses Cron), it uses the local timezone but doesn't outline this. We assumed that it was UTC like the other options.

There is also no mention as to whether the timezone is local to the user who owns that subscription, or is it local to the users in the recipients?

At the very least there should be mention of the fact it uses the users' local timezone or should be converted to UTC to prevent confusion and improve consistency.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Inconsistent time setting when setting Filter Subscriptions

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-59566].
  {panel}

*Feature Summary*
When a user runs the JIRA Update Checker when they are planning to perform an upgrade from JIRA 6.4.11 to JIRA 7.0.9, they get notified that some of the system plugins are incompatible as seen below:

*Incompatible:*
Bitbucket Importer Plugin for JIM - v1.0.15
JIRA GitHub Issue Importer - v2.0.10
Redmine Importers Plugin for JIM - v2.1.4

*Unknown:*
Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin - v7.3.2
Atlassian Hipchat Integration Plugin Core - v7.3.2
Support Healthcheck Plugin - v2.0.5

*Actual Result*
Oddly most of the plugins listed as incompatible and unknown are JIRA system plugins which we have upgrades for in the newer version of JIRA.

*Expected Behavior*
Instead of listing these as incompatible or unknown, I believe they should be listed as having updates as they do have working updates in the newer version of JIRA.
